name: Python Cheatsheet Repository Ruleset
purpose: Collect concise Python snippets and examples; encourage clear, small contributions.

contribution.open_issue: Open an issue to propose new content or improvements.
contribution.fork_and_pr: Fork the repo, create a branch (see branchNaming), and open a pull request.
contribution.small_prs: Keep PRs small and focused (one topic/feature per PR).
contribution.tests: Include tests or runnable examples when applicable.
contribution.review: All PRs are reviewed and approved by maintainers before merge.

pullRequestChecklist: Updated README or docs if needed

codeStyle.python: Follow PEP 8; use black for formatting when possible.
codeStyle.javascript: Follow existing ESLint/Prettier config in the repo.
codeStyle.examples: Keep examples short (<= 10 lines when practical) and runnable.

codeOfConduct: Add CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md to set community expectations.
testing: Add unit or integration tests for core components; prefer small, fast tests.

issues.template: Provide a clear description, steps to reproduce (if bug), or suggested snippet/content.

visibility: Use issues and PRs for discussion; keep commit history tidy and descriptive.
contact: Open an issue or comment on a PR for questions or requests.
